com.joliciel.talismane.parser

Interface Parser

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    NonDeterministicParser
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TransitionBasedParser

    public interface Parser
    A syntax parser which takes a pos tag sequence and provides a parse configuration.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

      ParseConfiguration parseSentence(PosTagSequence posTagSequence)
      Analyse a pos-tag sequence, and return the most likely parse configuration for the sentence.

    • Method Detail

      • parseSentence

        ParseConfiguration parseSentence(PosTagSequence posTagSequence)
                          throws UnknownDependencyLabelException,
                                 UnknownTransitionException,
                                 InvalidTransitionException,
                                 CircularDependencyException,
                                 TalismaneException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Analyse a pos-tag sequence, and return the most likely parse configuration for the sentence.
        Parameters:
        posTagSequence - the likely pos-tag sequence for this sentence.
        Returns:
        the most likely parse configuration for this sentence
        Throws:
        CircularDependencyException
        InvalidTransitionException
        UnknownTransitionException
        UnknownDependencyLabelException
        TalismaneException
        java.io.IOException

      • addObserver

        void addObserver(ClassificationObserver observer)

      • getTransitionSystem

        TransitionSystem getTransitionSystem()
        The transition system used by this parser to make parse decisions.

      • getMaxAnalysisTimePerSentence

        int getMaxAnalysisTimePerSentence()
        The maximum time alloted per sentence for parse tree analysis, in seconds. Will be ignored if set to 0. If analysis jumps out because of time-out, there will be a parse-forest instead of a parse-tree, with several nodes left unattached.

      • getMinFreeMemory

        int getMinFreeMemory()
        The minimum amount of remaining free memory to continue a parse, in kilobytes. Will be ignored is set to 0. If analysis jumps out because of free memory descends below this limit, there will be a parse-forest instead of a parse-tree, with several nodes left unattached.

      • getParserRules

        java.util.List<ParserRule> getParserRules()
        Rules to apply while parsing (in place of the probablistic classifier).

      • getParseComparisonStrategy

        ParseComparisonStrategy getParseComparisonStrategy()

      • getParseFeatures

        java.util.Set<ParseConfigurationFeature<?>> getParseFeatures()

      • cloneParser

        Parser cloneParser()
